text: Here's how to see your Twitch chat
while streaming on a single monitor.
First, open OBS Streamlabs.

OBS Streamlabs is an easy
way to manage your livestream
and is very similar to regular OBS.
For more information on using OBS,

check out our link in
the description below.

Once you're logged in to
Streamlabs, open your settings,
then select "Game Overlay."

Here you can choose if
you want to see the chat
or events window in the overlay.

"Toggle positioning mode"
allows you to position them
to your liking.
We will return to opacity in a moment.
Next we're going to create a hotkey

so we can quickly turn
in-game overlay on and off.
Inside the hotkey settings,
find "Toggle in-game overlay."

Click inside the box and
then choose your hotkey.
I'll be using F4.

Also set a hotkey for "Toggle
overlay positioning mode."
I will use F3.

Now go back to the
"Game Overlay" settings.
Click your hotkey to toggle the overlay on
and see if the opacity is where you like.
Then click "Done."

Now you can toggle your chat
on and off while playing

and reposition it without
leaving your game.
A small tip here:

Make sure that you're using
game capture as your source
and not screen capture

so that your chat overlay will
not be shown in your stream.
